title: OnePlus 13 series India launch on 7 January: Price, Specifications, and live streaming details - India TV News
summary:
OnePlus 13 Series India Launch on 7 January: Price, Specifications, and Live Streaming Details

Publication Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: India TV

OnePlus is poised to unveil its flagship smartphones, the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, on January 7, 2025, as part of its Winter Event in India. The event will also introduce the OnePlus Buds Pro 3. Following a successful launch in China, there is significant excitement among Indian consumers.

Key Points:

  • The expected price for the OnePlus 13 ranges between Rs 67,000 and Rs 70,000, reflecting a slight increase from its predecessor.
  • It features a 6.82-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • The OnePlus 13 is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, enhancing multitasking and gaming performance.
  • The camera system includes three 50MP sensors co-engineered with Hasselblad.
  • The smartphone is backed by a 6,000mAh battery with 100W fast charging capabilities.

How to Watch the OnePlus Winter Event Live:

The event will be streamed live on the OnePlus official website and YouTube channel on January 7.

Notable Quotes:

“With its latest flagship, OnePlus aims to strengthen its position in the premium smartphone segment.”

Overall, the upcoming launch of the OnePlus 13 series is anticipated to generate significant interest and engagement among tech enthusiasts in India.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 Series Launching in India on January 7: Pricing, Specs, and Live Stream Details

title: Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition's launch date and design revealed - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
Researchers are developing AI system that will let humans 'talk' to animals - Firstpost
summary:
Researchers Developing AI System to Facilitate Communication with Animals

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Firstpost

The Earth Species Project has introduced NatureLM, an AI designed to decode animal communication, aiming to enhance human-animal interactions.

  • NatureLM can identify animal species and context, including age and emotional state.
  • The AI is capable of understanding communications from species it hasn’t directly encountered before.
  • Efforts are underway to address the biodiversity crisis, fostering a deeper connection with the natural world.
  • Research showcases that some animals, like prairie dogs, use complex languages that combine nouns and adjectives.
  • NatureLM is part of a larger trend of using AI to tackle environmental issues, such as climate change.
“Decoding animal communication could bridge the gap between humans and the natural world,” said Katie Zacarian, CEO of the Earth Species Project.

As technologies like NatureLM evolve, they may significantly change our understanding of animal behavior and rights, moving us closer to a time when we can communicate with animals more effectively.
newTitle: Researchers Developing AI System to Facilitate Communication with Animals

title: Apple Vision Pro production halted amid weak demand: Report - The Hindu
summary:
Apple Vision Pro Production Halted Amid Weak Demand

Published: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The production of Apple's first-generation Vision Pro headset has reportedly stopped due to weak demand. Initially launched as a high-end mixed-reality device, the production has seen significant cuts.

  • The Vision Pro's production was scaled back to just 1,000 units daily by October, a 50% decrease from previous levels.
  • Apple has accumulated an inventory of 500,000 to 600,000 units, enough to meet demand through 2025.
  • The device's high price of $3,499 and limited content availability have led to low sales.
  • Apple plans to pivot towards developing a more affordable mixed-reality headset.
  • Development on a second-generation Vision Pro has been paused for at least a year, although an incremental update for the first generation is possible by late 2025 or early 2026.
“The Vision Pro has struggled to gain traction due to its steep price tag and is viewed as an 'early-adopter product.'”

In conclusion, the halt in production reflects Apple's challenges in the mixed-reality market and a strategic shift towards a more accessible product line.
newTitle: Apple Vision Pro Production Halted Amid Weak Demand

title: Quordle Answer for Today (January 2); Hints, Answers & How to Play? - Gizbot
summary:
Quordle Answer for Today (January 2); Hints, Answers & How to Play?

Updated: Thursday, January 2, 2025, 9:32 [IST]

Quordle is a unique word game where players solve four puzzles at once. For those looking for today's (Quordle 1074) hints and answers, you can find them below.

Quordle 1074 Hints For January 2, 2025

Starting Letters: U, S, D, I
Ending Letters: Y, E, T, O

  • Word 1 - Make or become united
  • Word 2 - Make a solemn statement or promise undertaking to do something
  • Word 3 - A place for the storage of large quantities of equipment
  • Word 4 - An introduction

Quordle 1074 Answers For January 2, 2025

  • Word 1 - UNIFY
  • Word 2 - SWORE
  • Word 3 - DEPOT
  • Word 4 - INTRO

How to Play Quordle?

Start Quordle by selecting any five-letter word. Each grid will display guessed letters in different colours indicating their position or relevance to the target words.

Green indicates the correct letter and position, yellow means it is in the word but not in the right spot, and grey shows it isn't part of any of the words. Use these colour-coded hints to inform your guesses.

Quordle is both a challenge and enjoyable, so take your time and visit Merriam-Webster's website regularly for updates.
newTitle: Quordle Answer for January 2, 2025: Hints and Solutions

title: Samsung is redesigning Good Lock with One UI 7 alongside global Play Store release - 9to5Google
summary:
Samsung is redesigning Good Lock with One UI 7 alongside global Play Store release

Publication Date: December 30, 2024   Source: 9to5Google

Samsung's Good Lock app, known for enabling extensive customization of One UI, is set to become available globally via the Google Play Store in 2025. This expansion coincides with the launch of One UI 7.

  • Good Lock offers deep customizations for Samsung devices without requiring root access.
  • Starting with One UI 7, Good Lock will be available in all countries and on the Google Play Store.
  • The app is undergoing a redesign to enhance usability and add features like filtered app listings.
  • Currently in beta, One UI 7 is expected to roll out with the Galaxy S25 series in January.

“Starting with One UI 7.0 Good Lock, Good Lock can be downloaded from the Play Store as well as the Galaxy Store, and Good Lock can be used in all countries. This is something that many customers have been asking for, and we expect that this will provide more convenient accessibility to more Galaxy users.”

This update aims to make the Good Lock app more accessible and functional for users worldwide, enhancing the customization experience for Samsung devices.
newTitle: Samsung Redesigns Good Lock with One UI 7 and Expands to Google Play Store

title: Dollar trade finance dips as demand for local currencies rises: JPMorgan's Zhang | Mint - Mint
summary:
Dollar Trade Finance Dips as Demand for Local Currencies Rises: JPMorgan's Zhang

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Mint

There has been a mild decline in the use of US dollars for trade finance in the Asia Pacific region, with demand for local currency financing increasing to fill the gap, according to a senior banker at JPMorgan.

  • Currency trends show a decrease in US dollar usage in trade finance.
  • Local currency financing is on the rise to bridge the gap.

Currency trends have been very interesting over the last few years, specifically in trade finance, where the bank has observed a mild decrease in US dollar usage, Charley Zhang, head of trade and working capital, APAC at JPMorgan, said in a virtual interview.

This shift in currency usage may have implications for the region's trade dynamics and financial stability.
newTitle: Decline in USD Trade Finance Usage in Asia Pacific

title: Drug firms amp up hiring for top roles as growth beckons | Mint - Mint
summary:
Drug firms amp up hiring for top roles as growth beckons

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: Mint

India's pharmaceutical companies are significantly increasing their hiring at the executive level to support growth amid favorable geopolitical forces.

  • Drugmakers are focusing on hiring key executives such as chief technology officers (CTOs), chief financial officers (CFOs), and chief human resources officers (CHROs).
  • There is an emphasis on hiring leadership for both emerging and regulated markets.
“The industry is finding it necessary to bolster its leadership team to navigate the expansion,” said an industry executive.

This trend reflects confidence in the pharmaceutical sector's future, with companies positioning themselves to leverage new opportunities.
newTitle: Drug Firms Increase Executive Hiring as Growth Opportunities Arise
